image.altText: The outside of the County Court of Victoria building.

props.synopsis: A Master Builders Association of Victoria board member fails in their bid to identify the person who made a complaint about their conduct â€” provoking a colourful ruling from the presiding judge.

title.children: Bid to unmask complainant in board dispute likened to John Grisham novel

image.altText: A man in a dark-blue shirt stands in the middle of a winery with bottles light up on the walls.

props.synopsis: From wine in 187ml bottles to spirits in sleek aluminium cans, producers are downsizing to meet a growing demand for convenience and variety.

title.children: Alcohol industry explores smaller packaging for 'promiscuous' customers

image.altText: A slightly run-down wood panel house with a neatly mown lawn.

props.synopsis: The median house price in regional Victoria is $636,500. But what that will get you can look very different from place to place.

title.children: What does the average house price get you in regional Victoria?

image.altText: Ben Austin's photo on a screen at a cricket ground

props.synopsis: Cricketers at the highest levels of the sport have paid tribute to 17-year-old Ben Austin who died on Thursday after being struck by a ball at a training session.

title.children: Minute's silence at MCG as cricketing world raises its bat for Ben Austin

image.altText: North Melbourne plays stand arm in arm to sing the team song after a win

props.synopsis: North Melbourne becomes the first male or female VFL/AFL team to win 24 consecutive games after prevailing over Hawthorn by 49 points.

title.children: North makes history with 24th consecutive AFLW win

image.altText: A man in a black suit flanked by security guards exits a prison van and enters the Supreme Court of Victoria.

props.synopsis: Greg Lynn's lawyer says the prosecution "played outside the rules" during the former Jetstar pilot's double-murder trial last year as he appeals his conviction and sentence.

title.children: Greg Lynn faces court in bid to quash High Country murder conviction

image.altText: A Facebook post written by Isla Bell's mother with a photo of Isla smiling underneath

props.synopsis: A judge rules there is enough evidence to send Marat Ganiev and co-accused Eyal Yaffe to trial over the death of the 19-year-old, whose body was found at a tip in Melbourne's south-east last year.

title.children: Melbourne woman Isla Bell's alleged murderer committed to stand trial

image.altText: Josh Hazlewood in green and gold cricket attire with the number '38', celebrating with his arms outstretched

props.synopsis: A lethal spell from Josh Hazlewood has propelled Australia to an emphatic four-wicket Twenty20 win over India in front of 82,438 fans at the MCG.

title.children: Hazlewood and Marsh dominate T20 as Australia beat India at MCG

image.altText: People with their fists raised

props.synopsis: Historic legislation has passed that will see the creation of an Indigenous council that will be consulted on laws and policies affecting Indigenous communities.

title.children: Australian-first treaty legislation passes in Victorian parliament

image.altText: A coal-fired power station on an overcast day

props.synopsis: AGL is preparing to shed hundreds jobs as part of a massive restructure aimed at freeing up capital to accelerate its transition away from coal and towards renewables.

title.children: AGL to shed hundreds of coal jobs and accelerate green transition

image.altText: A woman looks at a plant that is tall and has almost black flowers.

props.synopsis: While red roses have their moment on Valentine's Day, these "black suited" irises come into bloom close to Halloween.

title.children: 'Near black' flowers that bloom just in time for Halloween

image.altText: A building with brown designer facade that says Shepparton Law Courts.

props.synopsis: A jury has found a 29-year-old Vanuatu national guilty of the rape and abduction of a woman in Shepparton in August last year.

title.children: Man found guilty of raping woman he found unconscious on nature strip

image.altText: A ariel shot of a man standing surrounded by rings of barbed wire.

props.synopsis: Wongarra man Doug Gimesy removes more than 18 kilometres of barbed wire from his property to create a wildlife haven.Â

title.children: The quiet movement removing barbed wire fences to save wildlife

image.altText: Roadside sign on a trailer saying TUNE TO ABC. There are gum trees along the side of the road.

props.synopsis: As ABC Gippsland celebrates its 90th birthday, those behind the microphones have shared their key memories; from the heartwarming to the heartbreaking.

title.children: A trusted friend in good times and bad, ABC Gippsland marks 90 years

image.altText: The back of a female firefighter.

props.synopsis: The Australian Workers' Union says Victorian female forest firefighters have been short-changed by an average of more than $4,000 in pay growth since 2019.

title.children: Female firies earning thousands less than male colleagues

image.altText: A sketch of a man with grey hair and glasses in a grey jacket, white collared shirt and dark tie.

props.synopsis: Witnesses, including a former neighbour and a former homicide detective, have told a Melbourne court what they saw at the crime scene following murders in Collingwood nearly 50 years ago.

title.children: Former detective reveals horrific crime scene details in Easey St murders

image.altText: A green cricket helmet sits on a fence at a cricket oval.

props.synopsis: Following the death of 17-year-old Ben Austin, experts, including the former doctor for the Australian cricket team, say more focus needs to be put on neck protection at all levels of the sport.Â

title.children: Calls for mandatory protection in cricket after tragic Melbourne death

image.altText: Andrew Bolt in a suit and tie at a desk in a TV studio, looking into camera.

props.synopsis: Senior managers at the National Broadband Network intervened to accelerate a home internet upgrade for News Corp pundit Andrew Bolt and resolve a technical problem for a top executive's friend during the final stages of the infrastructure project's rollout.

title.children: 'Throw the kitchen sink at it': NBN Co fast-tracked upgrade for Bolt

image.altText: A man in an orange robe and red beanie arriving at court.

props.synopsis: Naotunne Vijitha, the former head monk at Dhamma Sarana temple in Melbourne, was found guilty of sex offences against six girls from 1994 to 2002.Â

title.children: Buddhist monk found guilty of historical Melbourne sex offences

image.altText: NRL player running with the ball, passing to his left.

props.synopsis: Melbourne Storm premiership winner Ryan Papenhuyzen has been granted an immediate release from the club, with one year still remaining on his contract.

title.children: Papenhuyzen granted release from Storm to consider future amid R360 talk

image.altText: Jennifer holding a framed photograph of her and her younger brother when they were kids.

props.synopsis: The closure of the Olympic Leisure Centre public pool in Melbourne's north-east today has left local swimmers adrift, with many saying there are no other options for them to swim.

title.children: Jennifer's brother drowned in her local pool. But even she's 'ashamed' it's closing

image.altText: Five people stand in front of a prison.

props.synopsis: The Malmsbury community had big dreams for the future of a decommissioned youth justice centre in town. Then came the news it was reopening.

title.children: Community blindsided by reopening of youth justice centre

image.altText: A worker in high-vis stands next to the interior of a ship hull showing crossbeams of metal.

props.synopsis: From wharfless ferries to bungled design specifications costing millions, the troubled Spirit of Tasmania ship replacement project saga just keeps rolling on.

title.children: How Tasmania's ferry operator made a multi-million-dollar mistake

image.altText: A split image showing two dark-haired AFL players.

props.synopsis: Dion Prestia and Steven May are charged by police over their alleged involvement in a brawl in a Victorian coastal town last December.

title.children: AFL players charged over alleged involvement in Boxing Day brawl

image.altText: Victorian police officer from behind

props.synopsis: Victoria Police says the number of people who have died in head-on crashes this year has increased by 75 per cent.

title.children: Police issue warning after increase in fatal head-on crashes

image.altText: A woman looks seriously down the barrel of a camera.

props.synopsis: A woman, who was unable to call triple-0 after men broke into her home while she was in her bedroom, is demanding answers from the telco as calls ramp up for a complete overhaul of the system.

title.children: Melbourne woman saw robber but could not call police using triple-0

image.altText: woman smiling sitting on a chair with brown hair in her 30s, with toys in the background

props.synopsis: After battling suicidal thoughts as a new mother, Monique Aulich now supports others going through the same pain.

title.children: Postnatal mental health units still out of reach for many mothers

image.altText: Phar Lap with jockey Jim Pike riding at Flemington race track circa 1930

props.synopsis: As the 2025 Melbourne Cup approaches, two musicals celebrating â€” and satirising â€” the life of Phar Lap premiere, with "Australia's greatest racehorse" brought to life with an actor and a puppeteer.

title.children: Phar Lap turns 100 in 2026. This year, two musicals inspired by him debut

image.altText: A hand holding a phone with the BOM website

props.synopsis: Environment Minister Murray Watt tells the Bureau of Meteorology that its new $4.1 million website needs to be fixed after complaints from users.

title.children: Bureau of Meteorology ordered to fix new website after torrent of complaints

image.altText: A view from under a large, leafy green tree.

props.synopsis: Residents of a small Victorian town hope a Tree of the Year award will save a beloved Algerian oak from being chopped down to make way for transmission lines.

title.children: Victoria's Tree of the Year threatened by the Western Renewables Link

image.altText: A mosaic of close-ups of faces, mostly eyes and some mouths. The faces are black and white.

props.synopsis: The true scale of abuse in Australia's childcare centres has been hidden. With 200,000 pages of previously confidential files, police tip-offs, and evidence from whistleblowers, Four Corners exposes the reality.

title.children: 'These monsters are thriving': Paedophiles have infiltrated childcare centres

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with a small Bluey toy and colourful dollhouse.

props.synopsis: Victorian authorities have received almost 1,000 reports of alleged abuse and misconduct against early childhood educators in the past year, according to a new watchdog report.

title.children: Shocking scale of childcare abuse allegations laid bare in new report

image.altText: Georgie Cleaver of the Eagles competes with Giselle Davies of the Swans.

props.synopsis: The final round of the AFLW home and away season promises to be nervous watching for more than half the competition's fans as eleven sides battle for seven finals spots up for grabs.

title.children: 'Most that's been on the line for many clubs': AFLW heads into final round

image.altText: An umpire throws the ball in

props.synopsis: The AFL confirms the arrival of the last disposal rule as one of seven rule changes aimed at making umpires' jobs easier while shortening the length of games.

title.children: Last disposal rule headlines AFL's seven changes for 2026 season

image.altText: Dry farmland beneath a mostly clear sky.

props.synopsis: The Federation of Victorian Traditional Owner Corporations calls for a pause on mining approvals until a formal benefit-sharing agreement is in place.

title.children: Traditional owner group calls for a pause on Victorian mining approvals
